links.*: The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power
The Lord of the Rings (film series)

wikitext.*:
{{expansion}}
[[File:New Line Cinema 2011 WarnerMedia Byline.png|thumb|175px|The current logo of New Line Cinema, owned by Warner Bros. Discovery.]]
'''New Line Cinema''' is an American film production studio.It was founded in [[1967]] by Robert Shaye. In [[2008]], it was merged with [[Warner Bros.]] and as result, it is now a subsidiary of Warner Bros., which in turn, belongs in Warner Bros. Discovery. The current president is Richard Brener.

[[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (film series)]] has New Line Cinema to thank for funding them, something which other film companies were afraid to do. New Line Cinema has also been involved alongside [[MGM]], in the production of [[The Hobbit (film series)|''The Hobbit'' (film series)]].

Currently, it is involved, as a co-producer, in conjuction with [[Tolkien Estate]], [[The Tolkien Trust]] and [[HarperCollins]], in the production of [[The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power]], although the main producer is [[Amazon.com Incorporated|Amazon]].<ref>{{webcite|articleurl=http://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/13/arts/television/lord-of-the-rings-series-amazon.html|articlename=‘Lord of the Rings’ Series Coming to Amazon|website=[https://www.nytimes.com/ New York Times]|accessed=13 November 2017}}</ref>
